titleStmt.title: Heres Jack in a box, that will coniure the fox. Or, A new list of the new fashions now used in London. Come who buyes Jaek [sic] in a box, that will cunjure the fox, and move them to delight; it may serve as I may say, for to passe the time away, in the long winter night, to sit by a good fire, when the season doth require, your body to keepe warme: this booke of merriment, will yield you sweet content, and doe you no harme. This new merry booke was newly jnvented, but never before this time jmprinted. written by Laurence Price, in the moneth of October. 1656. Entered according to order.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Vere at the Angel without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: A1 is an additional woodcut title page, reading "Here's Jack in a box, that will coniure the fox."; text begins on A3v.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "7ber [i.e. September 13" (on A1 title page); the 7 in the imprint has been crossed out and replaced with a "6" (A2 title page).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
